issues.summary: Quarantine System: reactivation.spec.ts
issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: reactivation.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/63052
695 test runs, 536 test failures, 46 test retries, 23.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/63052 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #squad-nv-pet-food or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: [cls-dev-tools] Enhance progress tracking with checkpoint
issues.description:
We will want to enhance the CLI reporting with the following ;

h2. Features

# Automatic checkpoint creation after each customer
# Resume from interruption (Ctrl+C or crash)
# Real-time progress with:
## Progress bar
## Percentage complete
## Success/partial/failed counts
## Processing rate (customers/second)
## Elapsed time
## ETA
# Checkpoint files stored in {{reports/checkpoints/}}
# Checkpoints archived on successful completion

h2. Benefits

# Automatic recovery — no manual intervention needed after crashes

# Better visibility — real-time metrics show progress and ETA

# Safer resumption — file hash verification prevents errors

# Performance insights — identify slow migrations

# User-friendly — clear progress updates

The {{mr\_charge\_at\_checkout}} experiment on Statsig shows a *"Group Assignment Health" WARNING*:
\- *23.08% of checks return "NoValues"* \- The SDK was initialized but didn't successfully get values
\- Exposure stream shows entries with {{Rule: Uninitialized}} a

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
Summary from [the thread|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CJ5NL6LEQ/p1768238605167189?thread_ts=1767000918.770079&cid=CJ5NL6LEQ] with the Experimentation Core team:

{quote}The core problem is that the experimentation SDK fails to load its configuration file in about 2% to 4% of initializations across all brands.

* *Cause:* The configuration file is too large, and certain landing pages (like the plans page) are optimized to load it asynchronously via the network, which can time out after 1

issues.summary: [Dashboard] - Fetch OTP orders in the new OTP dashboard page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

In the OTP orders page {{app/pages/whitelabel/one-time-deliveries}} the endpoint from reactivation_bff is called on page render through the {{useOneTimeOrdersView}} hook. 

We will show a Header component containing a Title and Subtitle when data is available. 

!Screenshot 2025-12-03 at 20.24.13.png|width=376,height=81,alt="Screenshot 2025-12-03 at 20.24.13.png"!
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Tech details* 


Instead of directly fetching the orders from the root component {{OneTimeDeliveriesRoot}}, let’s create a new component called {{OneTimeOrdersPage}} that will be called from the root.

{noformat}/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/one-time-deliveries/
  ├── index.tsx                  # Root component with page guards
  └── OneTimeOrdersPage.tsx      # Main component with UI logic{noformat}

On mount in {{OneTimeOrdersPage}}, the request to fetch one-time orders can be triggered

POC branch[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/tree/feature%2FGOC-3059|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/tree/feature%2FGOC-3059|smart-link] 
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*AC*

# On page load, the OTP orders are fetched in {{OneTimeOrdersPage}} component
## Error and empty data are gracefully handled on OTP orders page
### On Error
### Empty Data
# When data is present, a Title and Subtitle is shown on OTP orders page
## *Title* : Your One-Time Orders
## *Subtitle :* See and track upcoming and past one-time orders

{panel}

comments.author: Madeeha Hasan
comments.body:
Checklist for Localize: 

□ Step 1: Create Google Sheet with translations (use "en")
□ Step 2: Submit Google Form (Tool = "Lokalize", Priority = Normal)
□ Step 3: Create PR adding keys to groups-kv.json
□ Step 4: Get PR approved by your team
□ Step 5: Merge PR
□ Step 6: Wait ~1 day for Lokalise sync
□ Step 7: Verify translations in app/translations/goodchop/en-US/one-time-orders.json
□ Step 8: Ship your feature!

issues.summary: [Honeycomb] Fix excessive span generated from Place Order handler
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*User Story / Description:*

There are several trace spans triggered from checkout success and error handlers compared to the actual spans generated from the place order fetch.

Instead, they should match near-same (ideally the same) amount of spans.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Ensure checkout error and success handlers are spamming the correctly trace spans.

*Testing Requirements:*

*Affected Brands:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Accessibility Requirements:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Developer Notes:*

The root cause might be the {{useCheckoutSuccessHandler}} and {{useCheckoutErrorHandler}}be rendered and re-creating a new span reference.

Another possibility might be the memoized callback returned from both hooks, be defined with reference types as dependences. This will result in the callback be re-created each time that the hooks above be rendered and re-create the spans again and again.

Board: [https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/board/snpnbrS3LW6|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/board/snpnbrS3LW6]

Honeycomb Queries:

* Checkout Order
** Query: [https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/tLDrAiePcEs|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/result/tLDrAiePcEs]
** Source: [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/data-access/checkout/checkout.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/data-access/checkout/checkout.ts] 
* VMS' checkout handlers
** Success:
*** Query: [https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/board-query/vGwstVudUA7/result/uReYkpL8cuf?cstype_0=stat|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/board-query/vGwstVudUA7/result/uReYkpL8cuf?cstype_0=stat]
*** Source: [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-checkout/express-checkout/hooks/useCheckoutSuccessHandler.ts|https://github.com/hell

issues.summary: [KTLO] Add to cart doesn't work on bundles for VMS subscribers
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description:*

As an active VMS subscriber, I want to be able to add bundles to my subscription.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Log in as a VMS subscriber
# Navigate to /products page
# Try to add any bundle to your subscription
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Expected result:*

# Bundle modal should be closed.
# The selected bundle should be added to the cart.
# Sliding cart should open to give the related feedback to the user.
# User should checkout to update their subscription (To discuss: how does it affect the subscription patch?)

*Testing Requirements:*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Actual result:*

“Add to cart” CTA doesn’t do anything.

!Screen Recording 2026-01-16 at 14.56.23.mov|width=835,alt="Screen Recording 2026-01-16 at 14.56.23.mov"!


{panel}
